pre-task.applicable-cars: C Car, S Car, T Car

list-item.para: Circuit breaker DOOR CONTROL CB33 switched to OFF.
Circuit breaker PA AMPLIFIER CB47 switched to OFF.
Circuit breaker COMMUNICATION SYSTEM CB48 switched to OFF.

activity.title: Service Communication Control Unit Circuit Card Assemblies

hazard.hazard-desc: If the inspection determines that corrective maintenance is required, report it to your supervisor to ensure that proper corrective action is taken.
When performing maintenance, finding access doors unlocked on normally-secured lockers or cabinets must be reported to supervisor.

step.para: Unlock and open locker L1 access door using NJ Transit coach key.

hazard.hazard-desc: Cables connected to locker equipment can cause electrical shock. Exercise care whenever accessing any of the electrical lockers. Failure to do so may result in injury or death.
The following steps are performed while some locker equipment may be powered. Exercise care whenever near powered equipment. Failure to do so may result in injury or death.

step.para: Unfasten 12 captive screws securing CCU hinged face plate.

Ensure following nine rack-mounted Circuit Card Assemblies (CCA) are correctly fitted to mounting rails inside CCU enclosure, are properly set into their backplane connectors, and are secured with upper and lower latch clips.
If necessary, unfasten latch clips, refit, and reconnect CCAs before re-fastening latch clips.
Close CCU hinged face plate and fasten 12 captive screws securing face plate.
Close and lock locker L1 access door using NJ Transit coach key.

list-item.para: Switch circuit breaker DOOR CONTROL CB33 to ON.
Switch circuit breaker PA AMPLIFIER CB47 to ON.
Switch circuit breaker COMMUNICATION SYSTEM CB48 to ON.

follow-on-tasks.para: Perform CCU Power-up Test. Refer to BOM00764H.
